course.title: Topics in International Trade
course.description: Covers advanced topics in international economics with a special emphasis on an analytical approach to the recent process of globalization. Topics include the role of multinational firms in the global economy, the effect of international outsourcing on wages, and trade and industrial development.
course.prerequisites: Economics 1535 and basic knowledge of calculus and econometrics.
course.notes: This course offers an optional writing requirement which if completed will satisfy the concentration writing requirement.
